definition: Robespierre (name)/Maximilien François Marie Isidore de Robespierre (1758-1794), French revolutionary leader, enthusiastic advocate of reign of terror 1791-1794
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Jacobin club, French revolutionary party that played a leading role in the reign of terror 1791-1794
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (1888-1938), Soviet revolutionary theorist, executed after a show trial in 1937
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Talleyrand (name)/Prince Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord (1754-1838), French diplomat
Paris Commune 1871, an unsuccessful proletarian uprising against the French Third Republic
Brutus (name)/Marcus Junius Brutus (85-42 BC), late Roman Republic politician who conspired against Julius Caesar/Lucius Junius Brutus (6th c. BC), founder of the Roman Republic
